storyInfo: Logos fights the Nachzehrer King and rings his own death knell.

attributes.content: All the eye can see is death.
Endless killing. Life takes life. Fields of corpses, soaked in blood.
The first Nachzehrer learned his purpose when he rose from the ashes of battle.
'I am the end of all things.'
'Penetrate.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The incantation pierces the Nachzehrer like a lance.
It happened so fast that it was almost impossible to see its trajectory, as though it had taken effect by the time the word left the lips.
A smooth hole appears in Nezzsalem's chest.
There is no change in his expression. Withered branches reach down from his staff, reach into the hole in his torso, and fill in the gap.

attributes.text: How could this be?
In this battle alone, the young Banshee has casted dozens of Arts that were not of Sarkaz origin.
Ravel, the greatest Arts master of Gaul.
His life's work made the guns of Gaul's ships mighty, and he was famous in all the nations, before the Witch King made his own name known throughout the land.
In that war, there was an instant when the ships of Gaul ripped apart the lines of death like a sharp sword, before death swallowed them.
Why do I see a shadow of him in your Arts?

attributes.content: Your words can't kill me.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The voice that calls me is louder than your incantations by far.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...I can hear it.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The dirge of the fallen echoes within you.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Thousands of war altars, spread across the battlefield.
They absorb what life leaves behind when it dies.
The culmination of the power stands before Logos.
The most powerful Nachzehrer, and the most terrible war altar.
Nachzehrers witness death.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We take in all who were brave, friend or foe. In the endless cycle of life and death, they will be remembered and honored.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Cowards deserve only dust.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Tell me, my foeis it a young hero who stands before me, or a despicable traitor?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Your judgment does not interest me.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This is not where the power of words lie.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos once again gathers power in his palm.
A second wound appears on Nezzsalem's body, stretching from the shoulder to his chest.
The incantation does not dissipate. It fends off the branches trying to close in, and prevents the energies of the dead from repairing the Nachzehrer's body.
Shredded cloth rises and falls, covering the new wound, and countless old scars.
What is this?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Death may feed the Nachzehrer, but the Banshee can put death itself to rest.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You are no longer the sole master of war, Nezzsalem.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You're more gifted in incantation than any Banshee I know, Laqeramaline included.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A shame, though.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Why do you not sing for the dead, if you truly mourn them?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Elegy cannot actually put the dead to rest.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Neither the living nor the dead will find true rest, as long as war continues.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Preposterous!
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You have vanquished the Damazti and banished the Vampire. You, a sovereign of the Royal Court, have Royal Court blood on your hands.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You dare say it is all because you are avoiding war?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Is your rebellion the only reason you stand in my way?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer floats up in fury. The branches underneath him disintegrate, and decay fills the canyon.
The Banshee's chanting does not give ground.

attributes.text: Born in death, fueled by war, and nourishing death.
The life of the Nachzehrer is as war itself.
Cities and kingdoms rise and fall, but the fate of the Nachzehrer never changes.
Once, a Nachzehrer clan, tired of the cycle, put down their swords and staves and went into the depths of the wastes, far from civilization.
Their powers declined rapidly in peace, and they soon became prey for others, fading away in a forgotten corner of the land.
There is no other way to ensure the continued existence of the Nachzehrers.
The great rock of war sits above our heads on the slopes of time. All we can do is to push it with all our strength.
Such cycle has continued for thousands of years.
Until
We promise a war, Nachzehrer King
About the future, and nothing else.
My best students, the young twin royals. I taught them the laws of war. They stood before me and told me
We can end the monotony of war and break the rigid cycle.
We can push the rock to the top of the mountain and build a splendid palace with it.
This war will be my blaze of glory.
It must not end here!
That was a long time ago.
Now, a young Banshee stands before me.
How could they be so alike?

attributes.content: I fought alongside Laqeramaline for decades, across cities and plains. We buried the armor of Victoria and the guns of Gaul beneath the walls of Kazdel together.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: In the same battle, I helped Theresa take the heads of thousands of Leithanian casters.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: They were the heroes of Kazdel, its greatest warriors.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Laqeramaline entrusted you with the future of the Banshees. Theresa considered you one of her best students.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But you hid at Rhodes Island, sheltered the King of Sarkaz, and sneaked into Londinium like a thief, content to sabotage the cracks in the battlefield...
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: War will not end the suffering of the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: All I see is you dragging everyone into the abyss.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: So you chose to run.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Many years ago, I said to Theresa that war was unavoidable. If it did not come to Londinium, it would come to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Theresa agreed, but continued to hope that there could be another solution.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Her choice led to a new war. Its consequence was the death of the King of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I witnessed her death. All Sarkaz should honor her.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: What can you bring the Sarkaz aside from these meek words? What do you want to bring the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: He points his staff at the ground.
The scent of decay rushes out, overpowering the barrier of incantations.
(Growls)
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The dirge of the myriad souls grows louder.
The power of the incantations is weakening. He feels his fingers, lips and tongue go numb.
The fury does not come only from the ancient Royal Court sovereign before him.
It is also coming from his own blood.
I told you.
Duq'arael. I witnessed with my own eyes...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: ...My death?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You and the King both know you can't kill me.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: With your help, I've come to an... interesting place. It is not all nothingness beyond history.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: But I continue to gaze at you beyond the veil.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You have come so far, little Banshee... you and the Outblood King seek the drop of blood that I left behind.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The Blood of Teekaz... the pure blood that I coveted.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You believe that you can prevent calamity from occurring again by destroying it.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: It's true.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: 'True'. Destroy the altar, put a temporary stop to the Cunabula of Suffering, allow the Victorian nitwits to cling to life a bit longer. How boring.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Who is the one that's short-sighted and foolish here?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You feel it, don't you? You're closely linked to the altar. Right here, right now, your power is being boosted by it.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: It was never one drop of blood or a single person's call that awakened the Cunabula of Suffering.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Originium is the response to the call of all Sarkaz, living and dead. No exceptions.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: ...The murmur of the myriad souls is omnipresent.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The lament of the dead will not stop.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The Sarkaz are bound by the past from the moment of their birth, never to be freed, even unto death.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You witnessed the myriad souls the first time you sang an elegy... Laqeramaline proudly described your talent to us.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: This talent was the seed of dissent.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You feel pain, not just for others, but for yourself as well. You may detest the path I walk, but you could not help but feel sorrow for me sake.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I feel sorrow for how you're trapped by the past.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Such arrogance... I should try to kill you again.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: But instead, I will bless you.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The slaughterer and the slaughtered... they are all part of the cycle.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I am here because of you.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Logos does not smell any blood.
The incantation easily impales the Sanguinarch's body, causing only a few small ripples.
Your blood is still linked to my elegy.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Of course... of course. You stand with me, no matter how much you resist.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: We are all sovereigns of the Royal Court, after all... the oldest bloodlines of the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I should be glad that you could conquer me, for it proves that you are stronger, and more worthy of carrying the fate of the Sarkaz, leading them on your path.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The Sanguinarch of Vampires laughs, turning around and disappearing into the cave.
His silhouette fades away amongst the Originium crystals, but his voice continues to echo in Logos's ear.
Bless you, Aefanyl, my vanquisher.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Assimilate my blood. Utilize my power. Let your hatred of me fuel your battles!
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You will walk in my place and witness in my stead how far the flames of Sarkaz vengeance will burn.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Refuse.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Nachzehrer, Vampire, we all hear the same cry.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The fate of the Sarkaz is caught in a cycle, and I am no exception.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I am part of what I'm fighting.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The fury of the Sarkaz burns within my veins and my viscera.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Words turn into fire, descending from the sky to ignite every seed on the earth.
Incantations burn at Logos's fingertips, on his lips, in his chest.
Originium crystals grow furiously around him, and the crying of the dead becomes even louder, ready to accept him and devour him at any time.
He no longer rejects the power in his blood. The Vampire has guided the flames of the Sarkaz to him, and he has embraced the fire.
'The abyss lies before us. We can fill it with flesh, and burn the remnants with blood.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If the only way to bring new life is to burn away all the decay, then I will be both flame and fuel.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This is where my blood belongs, that I have chosen.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Flames consume the entire canyon.
The only things left are the incantations that the young Banshee has written his entire life, from a very young age.
They surround Logos loyally, his sword and shield.
If war is the only way to achieve the dream, and new life can only emerge from death...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I shall bring death.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I shall welcome death.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I shall ignite my past with blood, not for vengeance
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But for the day when this fire will burn away what shackles the Sarkaz, through the decay that covers the land.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A bone whistle sounds.
Logos knows that it is merely the echo of the bone whistle in the Valley of the Banshees, the night he set out for Babel.
From death comes new life.
The death knell rings.
For the Royal Court that would rot, past and future, and for himself.
